cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 115 mi ESE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Slowing, then turning northwest tonight and north on Tuesday, tracking toward the southeastern Louisiana–Mississippi coastline
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the mouth of the Mississippi River, southeastern Louisiana

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from the Mississippi/Alabama border eastward to the Alabama/Florida border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Morgan City, LA, to the Mississippi/Alabama border, including Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeastern Louisiana eastward across Mississippi and Alabama to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely beginning late Monday, with hurricane-force winds possible Tuesday as Sally nears landfall
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 3–5 ft above ground from Port Fourchon to the mouth of the Mississippi River; 4–6 ft possible in Lake Pontchartrain/Lake Maurepas which connect to port approaches
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–16 inches with isolated totals up to 24 inches possible, producing life-threatening flash flooding along the lower Mississippi River corridor
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands; dangerous surf and rip currents affecting marine approaches
